meanings.definition: A slender jointed part of the hand used for grasping and feeling.
meanings.sent1: She gently touched the soft fur with her finger.
meanings.sent2: He held the pencil between his thumb and finger.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten batted at the dangling string with its tiny finger.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the tree reached out like fingers towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The cold water sent shivers down her spine as she dipped her finger in.

meanings.definition: To touch or manipulate with the fingers.
meanings.sent1: She would often finger the smooth surface of the stone.
meanings.sent2: He carefully fingered the delicate petals of the flower.
meanings.sent3: The child giggled as he tried to finger-paint with his mashed potatoes.
meanings.sent4: The detective fingered the edge of the torn paper, deep in thought.
meanings.sent5: The musician's fingers danced across the piano keys with grace and precision.

meanings.definition: To indicate or point to something.
meanings.sent1: She used her finger to show the exact spot on the map.
meanings.sent2: He would often finger the passage in the book that he found most interesting.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to gently remind the student not to finger at others during the presentation.
meanings.sent4: The compass needle seemed to finger towards the north, guiding them on their journey.
meanings.sent5: His finger lingered on the page, hesitant to turn to the next chapter.
